location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

addressFamily.Description: IP address family. Example: ipv4 | ipv6.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

sequenceNumber.Description: sequenceNumber of the Access Control List.

protocol.Description: TCP/IP protocol as defined in the list of IP protocol numbers. Example: 255 (any) | 0 | 1.

createdBy.Description: The identity that created the resource.

createdByType.Description: The type of identity that created the resource.

lastModifiedBy.Description: The identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedByType.Description: The type of identity that last modified the resource.

lastModifiedAt.Description: The timestamp of resource last modification (UTC)

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

action.Description: Action to be taken on the configuration. Example: Permit | Deny.

communityMembers.Description: List the communityMembers of IP Community .

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

action.Description: Action to be taken on the configuration. Example: Permit | Deny.

routeTargets.Description: Route Target List.The expected formats are ASN(plain):NN >> example 4294967294:50, ASN.ASN:NN >> example 65533.65333:40, IP-address:NN >> example 10.10.10.10:65535. The possible values of ASN,NN are in range of 0-65535, ASN(plain) is in range of 0-4294967295.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

ipPrefixRules.Description: IpPrefix contains the list of IP PrefixRules objects.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

action.Description: Action to be taken on the configuration. Example: Permit | Deny.

sequenceNumber.Description: Sequence to insert to/delete from existing route. Prefix lists are evaluated starting with the lowest sequence number and continue down the list until a match is made. Once a match is made, the permit or deny statement is applied to that network and the rest of the list is ignored.

networkPrefix.Description: Network Prefix specifying IPv4/IPv6 packets to be permitted or denied. Example: 1.1.1.0/24 | 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::/126

subnetMaskLength.Description: SubnetMaskLength gives the minimum NetworkPrefix length to be matched.Possible values for IPv4 are 1 - 32. Possible values of IPv6 are 1 - 128.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

mtu.Description: maximum transmission unit. Default value is 1500.

disabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the L2 Isolation Domain is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

administrativeState.Description: state. Example: Enabled | Disabled. It indicates administrative state of the isolationDomain, whether it is enabled or disabled. If enabled, the configuration is applied on the devices. If disabled, the configuration is removed from the devices

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

disabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the L3 Isolation Domain is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

administrativeState.Description: Administrative state of the IsolationDomain. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

optionBDisabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the OptionB is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

aggregateRouteConfiguration.Description: List of Ipv4 and Ipv6 route configurations.

administrativeState.Description: Enabled/Disabled connected subnet route policy. Ex: Enabled | Disabled.

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

disabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the InternalNetwork is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

administrativeState.Description: Administrative state of the InternalNetwork. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

bgpDisabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the BGP is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

bfdDisabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the BFD for BGP is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

bfdForStaticRoutesDisabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the BFD of StaticRoutes is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

mtu.Description: Maximum transmission unit. Default value is 1500.

connectedIPv4Subnets.Description: List with object connected IPv4 Subnets.

connectedIPv6Subnets.Description: List with object connected IPv6 Subnets.

administrativeState.Description: Administrative state of the BfdConfiguration. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

multiplier.Description: Multiplier for the Bfd Configuration. Example: 3.

nextHop.Description: List of next hop IPv4 | IPv6 addresses.

allowAS.Description: Allows for routes to be received and processed even if the router detects its own ASN in the AS-Path. 0 is disable, Possible values are 1-10, default is 2.

ipv6NeighborAddress.Description: List with stringified IPv6 Neighbor Address.

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

networkToNetworkInterconnectId.Description: Gets the networkToNetworkInterconnectId of the resource.

disabledOnResources.Description: List of resources the externalNetwork is disabled on. Can be either entire NetworkFabric or NetworkRack.

administrativeState.Description: AdministrativeState of the externalNetwork. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

importRouteTargets.Description: Route Targets to be applied for incoming routes into CE.

exportRouteTargets.Description: Route Targets to be applied for outgoing routes from CE.

mtu.Description: MTU to use for option A peering.

primaryIpv4Prefix.Description: IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Example: 172.31.0.0/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

primaryIpv6Prefix.Description: IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Example: 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a0/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv4Prefix.Description: Secondary IPv4 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Example: 172.31.0.20/31. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

secondaryIpv6Prefix.Description: Secondary IPv6 Address Prefix of CE-PE interconnect links. Example: 3FFE:FFFF:0:CD30::a4/126. The values can be specified at the time of creation or can be updated afterwards. Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

version.Description: Current version of the device as defined in SKU.

networkDeviceRole.Description: networkDeviceRole is the device role: Example: CE | ToR.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

networkRackId.Description: Reference to network rack resource id.

hostName.Description: The host Name of the device.

serialNumber.Description: serialNumber of the format Make;Model;HardwareRevisionId;SerialNumber. Example: Arista;DCS-7280DR3-24;12.05;JPE21116969

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

administrativeState.Description: administrativeState of the network interface. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

connectedTo.Description: The arm resource id of the interface or compute server its connected to.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

networkFabricIds.Description: The NF-ID will be an input parameter used by the NF to link and get associated with the parent NFC Service.

workloadManagementNetwork.Description: A workload management network is required for all the tenant (workload) traffic. This traffic is only dedicated for Tenant workloads which are required to access internet or any other MSFT/Public endpoints.

ipv4AddressSpace.Description: IPv4 Network Fabric Controller Address Space.

ipv6AddressSpace.Description: IPv6 Network Fabric Controller Address Space.

operationalState.Description: The Operational Status would always be NULL. Look only in to the Provisioning state for the latest status.

provisioningState.Description: Provides you the latest status of the NFC service, whether it is Accepted, updating, Succeeded or Failed. During this process, the states keep changing based on the status of NFC provisioning.

infrastructureExpressRouteConnections.Description: As part of an update, the Infrastructure ExpressRoute CircuitID should be provided to create and Provision a NFC. This Express route is dedicated for Infrastructure services. (This is a Mandatory attribute)

workloadExpressRouteConnections.Description: As part of an update, the workload ExpressRoute CircuitID should be provided to create and Provision a NFC. This Express route is dedicated for Workload services. (This is a Mandatory attribute).

ipv4AddressSpaces.Description: The IPv4 Address space is optional, if the value is not defined at the time of NFC creation, then the default value 10.0.0.0/19 is considered. The IPV4 address subnet is an optional attribute.

ipv6AddressSpaces.Description: The IPv6 is not supported right now.

ipv4AddressSpaces.Description: The IPv4 Address space is optional, if the value is defined at the time of NFC creation, then the default value 10.0.0.0/19 is considered. The IPV4 address subnet is an optional attribute.

ipv6AddressSpaces.Description: The IPv6 is not supported right now.

name.Description: The NFC service will be hosted in a Managed resource group.

expressRouteCircuitId.Description: The express route circuit Azure resource ID, must be of type Microsoft.Network/expressRouteCircuits/circuitName. The ExpressRoute Circuit is a mandatory attribute.

expressRouteAuthorizationKey.Description: Authorization key for the circuit, must be of type Microsoft.Network/expressRouteCircuits/authorizations. The Auth Key is a mandatory attribute.

location.Description: The geo-location where the resource lives

systemData.Description: Azure Resource Manager metadata containing createdBy and modifiedBy information.

networkFabricSku.Description: Supported Network Fabric SKU.Example: Compute / Aggregate racks. Once the user chooses a particular SKU, only supported racks can be added to the Network Fabric. The SKU determines whether it is a single / multi rack Network Fabric.

rackCount.Description: Number of racks associated to Network Fabric.Possible values are from 2-8.

serverCountPerRack.Description: Number of servers.Possible values are from 1-16.

routerId.Description: Router Id of CE to be used for MP-BGP between PE and CE

fabricASN.Description: ASN of CE devices for CE/PE connectivity.

networkFabricControllerId.Description: Azure resource ID for the NetworkFabricController the NetworkFabric belongs.

terminalServerConfiguration.Description: Network and credentials configuration currently applied to terminal server.

managementNetworkConfiguration.Description: Configuration to be used to setup the management network.

operationalState.Description: Gets the operational state of the resource.

provisioningState.Description: Gets the provisioning state of the resource.

racks.Description: List of NetworkRack resource IDs under the Network Fabric. The number of racks allowed depends on the Network Fabric SKU.

l2IsolationDomains.Description: List of L2IsolationDomain resource IDs under the Network Fabric.

l3IsolationDomains.Description: List of L3IsolationDomain resource IDs under the Network Fabric.

networkDeviceId.Description: ARM Resource ID used for the NetworkDevice.

Any update to the values post-provisioning may disrupt traffic. The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

The 1st and 3rd IPs are to be configured on CE1 and CE2 for Option B interfaces. The 2nd and 4th IPs are to be configured on PE1 and PE2 for Option B interfaces.

username.Description: Username for the terminal server connection.

password.Description: Password for the terminal server connection.

administrativeState.Description: Indicates configuration state. Example: Enabled | Disabled.

networkToNetworkInterconnectId.Description: Gets the networkToNetworkInterconnectId of the resource.

nniType.Description: Type of NNI used. Example: CE | NPB

administrativeState.Description: Gets the administrativeState of the resource. Example -Enabled/Disabled

isManagementType.Description: Configuration to use NNI for Infrastructure Management. Example: True/False.

useOptionB.Description: Based on this parameter the layer2/layer3 is made as mandatory. Example: True/False

portCount.Description: Number of ports connected between PE/CE. Maximum value depends on FabricSKU.

mtu.Description: MTU of the packets between PE & CE.
